headline: Shrimp Fettuccine Alfredo
description: This shrimp fettuccine Alfredo recipe combines Parmesan cream sauce, tender shrimp, and chewy fettuccini pasta for an elegant special occasion dinner.

video.description: Adding shrimp to this fettuccine makes it an elegant entree.
video.name: Shrimp Fettuccine Alfredo

name: Shrimp Fettuccine Alfredo
recipeIngredient: 1 pound cooked shrimp - peeled and deveined

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil. Cook fettuccine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain.

Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir shrimp and garlic in butter for 1 minute. Pour in half-and-half; stir. Add Parmesan cheese, 1 tablespoon at a time, stirring constantly. Mix in parsley; season with salt. Simmer, stirring frequently, until sauce is thickened.
Stir fettuccine into sauce until evenly coated; serve hot.

review.reviewBody: I followed the recipe exactly and would agree it doesnâ€™t yield enough sauce. If I made used 1/2 lb pasta it might work, otherwise double the sauce.

I did not measure anything except the liquid. I used what I had on hand. Heavy whipping cream diluted with 2% milk. I used 2 cups. Hand full of a Italian blend cheese and some shaved Parmesan cheese, a little fetes and some dried parsley. I used a whisk to blend, then added my shrimp. Added steamed broccoli and carrots. It was pretty good, you can't mess this up.

There are a million things you can do with this recipe, but why? Itâ€™s perfect as written. Do not try to thicken it up. Just wait a few minutes after taking it off of the fire. No need to add this or that, make it as is. Simply delicious! Thanks for creating such a simple and delicious recipe and for sharing it!

I was impatient the first time I made it and had the heat too high, I turned my back for a second and the sauce came to a boil and broke the cream ðŸ˜­ tonight's attempt I stood over the pot and whisked constantly (I think this helped too instead of my wooden spoon) over medium heat and let simmer. Letting stand off the heat helped to thicken too. I will definitely make this again and again, the patient say!

This recipe is very tasty. I only had raw shrimp, so I sautÃ© it in garlic and butter, then added the other ingredients. I used heavy cream instead of half and half. The sauce came out perfect. My only concern is that it made three servings, not six.

I increased the Romano cheese to 8 ounces, added 8 oz sliced mushrooms with 1 big heaping tablespoon of chopped garlic in the initial saute, along with 4 oz butter and 1 lb peeled deveined raw shrimp and at least 1C chopped fresh parsely. Cook on medium heat for 5 minutes. Blend 1/2 & 1/2 with 2 tbsp corn starch before adding to skillet and it will be thick. Add cheese. Stir in pasta. Thin with 1/2 c pasta water if too thick. You can add fresh broccoli or any veggies with the mushrooms and garlic. Love love!
This turned out great. I also used grilled chicken breast (thinly sliced).
Turned out well! Do not as more salt! The Parmesan is salty enough

Delicious!! It's just me so I cut the recipe down as I don't like to reheat seafood. The sauce was very good, but I did take the advice of many reviewers and made extra. I'm glad I did that as I had the perfect amount. Next time I'm hungry for alfredo and shrimp this will be the recipe I pull out.

This recipe is all out of whack. The amount of sauce it makes is barely enough for 2 servings, let alone the 6 it was supposed to be for. And as a result I ended up with a ton of leftover fettuccini. The sauce it did make wasnâ€™t very flavourful and the pasta was dry as a result of a lack of sauce. Would not make again.

Also, the shrimp should be added in the last few minutes, not the first few, as it takes forever to thicken and the shrimp gets overcooked.
It was DELISH! My husband has requested it be added to his favorite meals list...lol

Ahhhh, this was quick, easy and delicious I did add a few other ingredients, however its great this way or can be used as a base for all types of favorite toppings

suggestions: broccoli 
green and red peppers 
etc. and for a creamier taste I added whipping cream and sour cream
I did not use parsley, I did not have any. I used heavy cream that was all I had, my husband said it was as good as our favorite restaurant.

Since you asked. I did make this basically and yes my substitutions were as follows. I used easy peel shrimp, large, one dozen. I sautÃ©ed the shells in butter, removed them, added more butter and garlic. Removed the garlic, added shrimp which I had dusted with Cajun spice removed them after cooking a minute on each side, added juice from dried mushrooms, should have added some red wine, then cooked frozen stir fry veggies and the mushrooms, removed them and put in 1 cup of heavy cream and 1.5 Cup milk, heated and added 12 Tablespoons of Parmesan cheese, grated. It was a labor of love, put it all together in the end and heated through with 9 ounces of fresh fettuccine noodles. Absolutely fantastic. SautÃ© shells is such an flavorful addition. Well worth the time. Fed 4 no leftovers.

Followed recipe & like others added sautÃ©ed shrimp before serving. Stirred in 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella & addl Parmesan. Easy WOW dinner from everyone. Allowed for 4 med. shrimp per person. SautÃ©ed shrimp in corn starch to keep pink & moist 3-4 min. Cornstarch on shrimp aided in thickening of sauce.
Made a few times now. Excellent and easy recipe!
Easy to make and just so wonderful. I have made it several time!

it was very good! it does take awhile for sauce to thicken. I cheated added a little 
cornstarch towards the end. shrimp was
perfect, I got the nice sized ones that turn
round. This will be my Go To recipe for this.
the calories were not too crazy high.
Delicious and easy. I added broccoli and a teaspoon of cream cheese. After reading the other reviews, I seasoned and cooked the shrimp separately. I added it the end.
Very easy and tasty. I added just a sprinkle or two of Bays seasoning as a garnish. Itâ€™s a recipe that can be changed as you wish and still comes out fantastic.
Simple to make & delicious!
Made per the recipe. Next time I'll use smaller shrimp.

When my wife says "You can make that ANYTIME!", then it's a keeper. As others have said though, I will be removing the shrimp from the pan after the brief encounter with the garlic, then adding back in after the sauce thickens. They definitely were somewhat overcooked.
Excellent. Made as directed only adding the half and half and Parmesan slowly to blend better; it also thickened nicely that way

I've made this for the family quite a few time's now. They love it. I did make some changes as to what other review's stated. It's Awesome! I did add steamed broccoli a couple times. It's very good with the broccoli. Thanks for the awesome recipe.
This recipe was easy as stated above. I added cherry tomatoes, quartered and spinach.
The sauce was to runny for my liking and the lack of seasoning was concerning. I made adjustments that I needed to make.

Great recipe, having said that I did make use of an Alton Brown tip and cooked the pasta from cold water, keeping it on low once al dente whilst making the sauce and utilizing a couple of tablespoons of the starchy water to emulsify and smooth out the sauce, reduced the cook time by about fifteen minutes as well!
So yummy!!!
Enjoyed very much, easy and quick to prepare.
Loved this recipe. It is fabulous as is. I know everyone dislikes it when people make changes to a recipe. The second time I made it, I did add saute'd mushrooms and broccoli.

DELICIOUS oh my goodness. I thought some of the others' suggestions sounded tasty and I added sauteed mushrooms, doubled the sauce, and added cornstarch to make it thicker. 
It probably would have thickened on its own if we took if off the heat like everyone else said, but the cornstarch was simple and worked great.

It was really goodâ€”great flavor. As others have echoed, add in the shrimp later. I used frozen shrimp and just added it directly to the pan. I think thatâ€™s what made my sauce waaaaayyyy too runny. I would defrost the shrimp first and add them later. I ended up adding about three tablespoons of cornstarch before it finally thickened up enough.
Just a few simple ingredients, and voila! You have an AMAZING meal! Absolutely delicious, and I didnâ€™t change a thing! Thank you for sharing.

Made it for my wife and I and we loved it. Put extra Parmesan and it was to kill for . Ate way too much of it, with a great wine of course


Thank you

I made this using raw (previously frozen) shrimp and omitted the chopped parsley and instead added a cup of Fresh chopped broccoli. I did NOT add the entire pound of pasta because it would of been way too much pasta and even dryer than it was. Very good flavor, easy to make but I would never use cooked shrimp and cook it that much again. Yuk. Use fresh or frozen shrimp thatâ€™s thawed and it will be perfect! I will use a little more cream next time so that itâ€™s stays creamy after adding all the pasta. It dries up fast. Hubby and I ate the entire pan and I donâ€™t usually eat lot!
way too much pasta for this little sauce. So, Cook your pasta the way you like it and just spoon the sauce over the pasta.

Great recipe! Easy to modify to what you have on hand! My husband HATES "homemade" alfredo, but this one he chows on. The one thing I ALWAYS do is add a pinch of nutmeg, it enhances the cream and cheese!
I prefer making a thin roux with the half and half before adding the Parmesan. It makes a thicker, richer sauce.
My husband asked me to make Shrimp Fettuccine today. So I searched for a recipe and decided to make this one. It turned out so good... I'm saving the recipe.

I have made this so many times since finding this recipe! Delicious every time! We usually have this about every other week now. My husband's Dr wants him to cut pasta. Tonight I made a change, I added a bunch of broccoli to the shrimp before adding the other ingredients. No pasta. Still delicious! Thank you for sharing this wonderful, easy, recipe!

This was a great shrimp fettucine alfredo. My husband likes his with cajun seasoning which was easy to add. I would, however, double or triple the sauce because there was barely enough for the two of us. Otherwise, absolutely delicious. I will definitely make it again!

This was delicious. I actually made it one time--don't know why it says two. It was so scrumptious and filling. I've made two minor tweaks to it--since I ran out of butter, I've used olive oil. And instead of fresh parsley, I've used dried flakes. It tasted real good. I would love to make it again sometime.
I used a little too much chicken (instead of shrimp) and it was pretty much flavorless. I even added some cream cheese to try to help, it did nothing for it.
Made this recipe with penne instead! Still turned out wonderful :)
This was very good. The second time I made it I tripled the sauce and added scallops and mushrooms.
great easy dish have made several times. I add zest and juice from 1/2 a lemon give a great citrus kick of flavor
Really good - but I added whipping cream & more butter than called for, and added a touch of cayenne pepper and onion salt. Kids loved it.
I loved making it, very easy to make, and friends and hubby enjoyed eating it thank you so much
It was okay. Followed the recipe and just wasnâ€™t impressed. Had very little flavor besides the cheese. Good nutrition though. Not trying to be rude but just my honest opinion.
This sauce is freaking amazing and everyone loved it! Definitely will be using this one for life!
I love this the sauce it was not to thick. Everything blended so well together. I will make again an again.
This dish looks so appetizing! I can't wait to eat/feed my children!

Easy, simple, fast...and so tasty and creamy. I like the idea of adding a shrimp stock to the Alfredo (must try next time). I followed a lot of your suggestions on here and doubled the garlic content, the half-and-half, and parmesan. I also added about a T or so of corn starch as well as a bit of pasta water to aid the thickening process (saves on time!). All in all, I think the flavors (cream, cheese, garlic, butter, shrimp) all married well together and made the dish flavorful, authentic, and creamy. By the way, the pasta itself also helps the sauce thicken...just mix it all up well and use the double ingredients or so for the sauce and you'll be quite pleased with the results! On a side note, I find you'll need more than 10 min for the pasta to cook Al dente; I cooked mine for 12 min and could have even used a minute or two more.
This was really good and yes I will make it again. I did not use half -and- half. I used condensed milk instead and it worked out really well.
Easy and delicious. Used raw shrimp and cooked it in the butter/garlic mixture. Came out perfect.

I did not make any changes. I usually make recipes as they are written the first time I make them and then decide what changes I may make the next time. I really like this recipe. It is simple and easy to make. The family loved it.
Easy and flavorful. I followed another reviewerâ€™s advice and added the cooked shrimp after the sauce thickened.
I used 1cup heavy cream and 1 cup regular milk, cooked shrimps and scallops first and add them at the end with the pasta , came out great!
Fantastico!
It was good, but not nearly enough sauce. I would double the sauce if you make it.
Something not mentioned is make sure you drain the butter, or your sauce comes out reddish.
Husband loved it. Added a teaspoon of smoked paprika for some extra flavor.

tasted delicious, used dried parsley instead of fresh and seemed to add the same amount of flavor. I'm not sure if I fully cooked the sauce since it was slightly liquid-y when I served it but it was still delicious!
Added mushrooms and spinach to it. Perfect!
I also added shredded parmesan cheese. Some how it curdled up. It was still very tasteful.

The flavor of the sauce earns this recipe 3 stars but as written this is again an example of using the wrong shrimp and way over cooking them to the point it degrades an excellent dish. The amount of sauce is also insufficient for a pound of fettuccine. I tried a second time using 16/20 raw peeled shrimp, cooked them with the garlic and butter while my wife prepared the sauce. We doubled the sauce amount and timed it so everything was ready at the same time. Turned out much better and we will make again in the amended version.
I didn't have heavy cream so I made my own from a recipe I saw on FB. Two thirds cup whole milk. One third cup butter. It was delicious.
Great very easy to make. Taste good
I like really moist pasta so I doubled the amount of sauce. It was great!
Absolutely EASY to make. I am very pleased with the flavor of this very simple sauce. Be patient, and let it thicken slowly and you will not regret choosing this recipe.

The only major change I made was a squeeze of lemon. I made it again with rotisserie chicken instead of shrimp and added a dash of Slap Ya Mama Cajun seasoning and fresh spinach. Both times I served over spaghetti squash topped with mozzarella.

Not enough sauce. Didnâ€™t have flavor until I added garlic salt and butter to the sauce. Even then the most flavor came from the shrimp I made with butter and garlic. I donâ€™t recommend this recipe.

This is a decent foundation however there were some changes I made: I doubled the ingredients for the sauce as its way too little sauce for the amount of ingredients. In fact, I think next time I would triple the sauce ingredients. I used whipping cream instead of half and half, added additional seasonings because it was pretty bland (pepper, onion powder, also make sure you add enough salt). I also added a little more cheese. We also enjoy broccoli with our alfredo which I steamed and added at the end with grilled shrimp. I did not add shrimp in the beginning as I did not want them to overcook. Also to thicken the sauce I added about a 1/2 tablespoon of flour...would've used cornstarch but I didn't have any on hand.
definitely making this again!
I let the garlic and butter saute before I added the shrimp.
this turned out beautifully and tasted great.
That was pretty darn good. Just a question of timing everything to be done at the right time
Made it according to the recipe. Excellent. I wonder if some people that had difficulty with it thickening used "boxed" parmesan cheese rather than fresh grated parmesan cheese.

Came out great and works well as a base recipe or as is. I added capers and artichoke hearts. I also added the pasta to the pan with the sauce while the sauce was still thin. Tossed it around a bit and then took it off the heat. Thickened up pretty fast after that.
Very good, but keep in mind it produces a thinner sauce. Switch to whipping cream for a thicker sauce.
So easy and very tasty!
It was pretty good but I think I will double the recipe for the sauce next time.
I used more garlic and straight heavy cream, so end product was very think and rich, but really delicious, just not something the cholesterol wants on a regular basis. Fast and simple.

Very good basic recipe! I did add a little cornstarch to the half and half before adding it to the shrimp. I didn't want to wait for the sauce to thicken by cooking it down. Other than that I served it over zoodles. Super good!
I substituted crab for the shrimp and added red and yellow peppers for color. It was delicious.
I used fresh shrimp instead and it turned out great. Plus it didn't need any additional salt because of the fresh parmesan cheese.
Very good

Not bad, of course I added a little Cajun spice to this recipe. The biggest Change Iâ€™ll make next time is Iâ€™ll add my shrimp after making the sauce and just before adding the noodles so theyâ€™ll stay more tender.
I added sautÃ©ed mushrooms and 1 tablespoon flour to the melted butter since I then used 2% milk instead of half and half. It was delicious and didn't take too long to thicken.

This is a quick and simple recipe for alfredo. I did make some modifications (I added mushrooms (inspired by the picture)) and I cooked the shrimp ahead of time and added at the end just to warm up - this prevented overcooking of the shrimp.
I found the recipe a little on the bland side. Perhaps, if I make it a gain, I'll add a pinch of red pepper flakes

It was a huge hit especially with my picky teen! Only thing I did differently was I made everything separate. I used 6oz of parmesan cheese. The sauce thickened (off heat) as I cooked the shrimp. Next time I will double the recipe for leftovers!
Normally my husband prefers a tomato based sauce for pasta, but he really liked this. I doubled the sauce and added fresh sliced mushrooms and a splash of white wine. The whole family loved it!
for someone who doesn't like the kitchen luv this recipe it was simple and easy to make. lets dont forget tasty

This was great! My only change was that I used some sliced mushrooms and a small amount of chopped sweet onions to go with the shrimp and garlic. At the very last I added ground parmajuan and Romano cheese.

Easy and delicious! I made exactly as written except I used 1 CUP of cheese because the sauce wasnt thickening, and other recipes for alfredo sauce seem to use much more cheese than this calls for. (I used 1 tsp dried parsley and 1/2 tsp salt) A lot of reviews say double the sauce, but I thought the proportions seemed fine. My whole family liked this, and it disappeared quickly!
Followed the recipe. Ok. Ok. I didnâ€™t add salt and It was still delicious.

I followed the recipe precisely other than my following a suggestion from another reviewer. I put the shrimp into the sauce at the very end after the sauce thickened. This made sure the shrimp were not overcooked. I also suggest that you taste the Parmesan sauce first before adding salt. I found that I did not need it because the parmesan cheese naturally added enough salt for my taste. This dish is easy and quick to make. My husband and I loved this dish!
